newsitem.title: UK: Wolseley bounces after recent falls.
newsitem.headline: Wolseley bounces after recent falls.

text.p: Shares in international building supplies group Wolseley Plc climbed on Tuesday after suffering losses in the previous four trading days, dealers said.
Wolseley shares gained 21-1/2p, or 4.8 percent, to 467p by 0840 GMT making it the second best performing stock amongst the top 350 UK companies.
"The stock has underperformed over the last few days and we are now seeing a bounce," said one dealer.
Wolseley shares had fallen around 12 percent in the last four trading days as concerns over the company's prospects in Europe weighed on the stock, analysts said.

"There is something of a two-way pull here," said Simon Brown, analyst at Williams de Broe. "On the one hand Wolseley has exposure to the U.S. distribution market but on the other it has exposure to Europe where, and in particular France, the prospects are more uncertain."
Brown said worries over a possible acquisition in Germany which could involve a fresh issue of equity had also undermined the shares performance in recent sessions.
